A histogram is the graphical presentation of the absolute frequency distribution.
A histogram is simply a bar chart of continuous data that has been classified into a
frequency distribution. The attractive feature of a histogram is that it allows us to
quickly see where most of the observations are concentrated.
To construct a histogram, the intervals are scaled on the horizontal axis and the absolute
frequencies are scaled on the vertical axis. The histogram for the Intelco returns data in
Table B from the previous example is provided in Figure 3.
